p.s: By informing the reader about the contamination of our world and the incurable diseases the writer is trying to get the readersreaders' attention on the environmental pollution which is happening right now.
Environmental pollution can have devastating effects on sea life, on crops and on human health (l. 13).
This means that the sea life, crops and the human health there are at risk of not existing anymore if the environmental pollution is not stopped any time soon.
... or simply take us fown the blind alleys of adversity(l. 18) is a metpahor for all the adversities we don't know about yet.
The writer mentions an industrial environment tragedy which occured in Bhopal on December 3, 1984 to make the reader attentive about the effects of environmental pollution (l. 29-32).
As a result of this tragedy over 2000 people, including women and children, lost their lifeslives and hundreds were severely hurt.
Ankita Mitra stressed this tragedy as the worst industrial environment tragedy (l. 29).
All in all you can say we need to look after the environment and try to reduce the industrial smoke or work.
